about.summary: Provides routines for the generation of response patterns under unidimensional dichotomous and polytomous computerized adaptive testing (CAT) framework. It holds many standard functions to estimate ability, select the first item(s) to administer and optimally select the next item, as well as several stopping rules. Options to control for item exposure and content balancing are also available (Magis and Barrada (2017) <doi:10.18637/jss.v076.c01>).

Provides routines for the generation of response patterns under unidimensional dichotomous and polytomous computerized adaptive testing (CAT) framework. It holds many standard functions to estimate ability, select the first item(s) to administer and optimally select the next item, as well as several stopping rules. Options to control for item exposure and content balancing are also available (Magis and Barrada (2017) <doi:10.18637/jss.v076.c01>).

name: r-catr
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '3.17' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-catr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/catR_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/catR/catR_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: e64471c3b14bd457b3f1c01f719c7ec114141cf2c24f75eb6957cee199c1179d

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  missing_dso_whitelist:
    - '*/R.dll'        # [win]
    - '*/Rblas.dll'    # [win]
    - '*/Rlapack.dll'  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
  run:
    - r-base

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('catR')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('catR')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=catR
  license: GPL-3.0-or-later
  summary: Provides routines for the generation of response patterns under unidimensional dichotomous
    and polytomous computerized adaptive testing (CAT) framework. It holds many standard
    functions to estimate ability, select the first item(s) to administer and optimally
    select the next item, as well as several stopping rules. Options to control for
    item exposure and content balancing are also available (Magis and Barrada (2017)
    <doi:10.18637/jss.v076.c01>).
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - frankier

# Package: catR
# Type: Package
# Title: Generation of IRT Response Patterns under Computerized Adaptive Testing
# Version: 3.17
# Date: 2022-06-23
# Author: David Magis (U Liege, Belgium), Gilles Raiche (UQAM, Canada), Juan Ramon Barrada (U Zaragoza, Spain)
# Maintainer: Cheng Hua <chuabest@gmail.com>
# Depends: R (>= 4.0.0)
# Description: Provides routines for the generation of response patterns under unidimensional dichotomous and polytomous computerized adaptive testing (CAT) framework. It holds many standard functions to estimate ability, select the first item(s) to administer and optimally select the next item, as well as several stopping rules. Options to control for item exposure and content balancing are also available (Magis and Barrada (2017) <doi:10.18637/jss.v076.c01>).
# License: GPL (>= 3)
# LazyLoad: yes
# RoxygenNote: 7.2.0
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2022-06-24 00:03:18 UTC; chenghua
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2022-06-24 08:00:02 UTC
